Populate the pipeline (generate files) without building

Source: R/rxp_populate.R
rxp_populate.Rd

rxp_populate() generates the pipeline assets (e.g., _rixpress/, pipeline.nix, dag.json) but does not build. It is equivalent to calling rixpress(build = FALSE). Additionally, you can inline Python import adjustments via py_imports.

Usage

rxp_populate(derivs, project_path = ".", py_imports = NULL, ...)

Arguments

derivs

A list of derivation objects created by rxp_*() helpers.

project_path

Path to the project root. Defaults to ".".

py_imports

Named character vector of Python import rewrites. Names are the base modules that rixpress auto-imports as "import ", and values are the desired import lines. For example: c(numpy = "import numpy as np", pillow = "from PIL import Image"). Each entry is applied by replacing "import " with the provided string across generated _rixpress Python library files.

...

Ignored when build = FALSE; kept for signature parity with rixpress().

Value

Invisibly returns NULL. Side effects: writes generated files.

See also

Other pipeline functions: rixpress(), rxp_make()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
list(
  rxp_py(
    name = "mdl",
    py_expr = "XGBClassifier()"
  )
) |>
  rxp_populate(
    py_imports = c(
      numpy   = "import numpy as np",
      xgboost = "from xgboost import XGBClassifier"
    )
  )

rxp_make()
} # }
